newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: Zimbabwe industrial index tumbles to record loss.
newsitem.headline: Zimbabwe industrial index tumbles to record loss.

text.p: A massive sell-off by small investors sank Zimbabwe's key industrial index a record 254.65 points or 2.4 percent to 10,343.51 on Thursday after interest rates jumped two percentage points in the money market.
"The pressure is coming mainly from fears that interest rates will rise even further than the 22.41 percent indicated at this morning's auction of TB's to the discount houses...," one broker said.
"I think this is likely to continue for another month or two given the absence of institutional and foreign investors," another broker added.

Thursday's drop in the 59-share index -- its second largest ever after a 274 point loss in January -- was caused by losses in bellwether stock Delta and agricultural implement maker Gulliver both down 70 cents to 1,700 and 230 respectively.
There were 50-cent falls in bankers NMB to 3,200, clothing retailers Truworths to 900, bankers Barclays to 3,050 and multi-industrial Apex to 250 cents.
In minings, a 25-cent loss in coal-miners Wankie, dropped the secondary index 9.1 points or 0.9 percent to 997.07, the first time in a month it has gone below 1,000.
